name: Square array A(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by downward antidiagonals: A(n,k) is the number of m-compositions of n with k zeros.
comment: For some m > 0, an m-composition of n is a rectangular array of nonnegative integers with m rows, at least one nonzero entry in each column, and having the sum of all entries equal to n.
link: John Tyler Rascoe, Antidiagonals n = 0..30, flattened
program: G_tx(max_row) = {my(row = max_row, N = row*2, m = List([concat([1],vector(row-1,i,0))]), x='x+O('x^N), h=1 + sum(m=1,N,-1+ 1/(1 + t^m - (t + x/(1-x))^m))); for(n=1,row, listput(m,Vecrev(polcoeff(h, n))[1..row])); matrix(row, row, i,j, m[i][j])}
author: _John Tyler Rascoe_, Apr 09 2025

name: Number of m-compositions of n with n zeros.
comment: For some m > 0, an m-composition of n is a rectangular array of nonnegative integers with m rows, at least one nonzero entry in each column, and having the sum of all entries equal to n.
program: G_tx(max_row) = {my(row = max_row, N = row*2, m = List([concat([1],vector(row-1,i,0))]), x='x+O('x^N), h=1 + sum(m=1,N,-1+ 1/(1 + t^m - (t + x/(1-x))^m))); for(n=1,row, listput(m,Vecrev(polcoeff(h, n))[1..row])); matrix(row, row, i,j, m[i][j])}
author: _John Tyler Rascoe_, Apr 09 2025
